snippet: ''Give us the tools to continue the revolution,'' said Tim LeFever, invoking a concept most other Republican Congressional candidates are avoiding this year.    But Mr. LeFever describes his second bid to defeat Representative Vic Fazio, a veteran...
lead_paragraph: ''Give us the tools to continue the revolution,'' said Tim LeFever, invoking a concept most other Republican Congressional candidates are avoiding this year. But Mr. LeFever describes his second bid to defeat Representative Vic Fazio, a veteran Democrat, in California's Third District as ''a continuation of our 1994 campaign.'' Then he held Mr. Fazio to just under 50 percent of the vote but lost by 8,029 votes. ''We were delayed, not defeated,'' he told Republican women in Woodland on Wednesday.
abstract: Article examines race for US House in California's Third Congressional District, where Republican Tim LeFever has launched second bid to defeat Democratic incumbent Repr Vic Fazio; map (M)

headline.main: 31 Republicans Who Lost in 1994 Return in Reruns
